metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12327 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - negligible
metadata.Description:
Stack-based buffer overflow in ntpq and ntpdc of NTP version 4.2.8p11allows an attacker to achieve code execution or escalate to higherprivileges via a long string as the argument for an IPv4 or IPv6command-line parameter. NOTE: It is unclear whether there are any commonsituations in which ntpq or ntpdc is used with a command line from anuntrusted source.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12327` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntp - 1:4.2.8p12+dfsg-3ubuntu3
ntpdate - 1:4.2.8p12+dfsg-3ubuntu3
sntp - 1:4.2.8p12+dfsg-3ubuntu3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ntp package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:4.2.8p12+dfsg-3ubuntu3').
